page.title: 13Hexham, a market centre.
page.content: Hexham is a busy market town in the centre of a farming area,with good livestock rearing and fattening farms and sheep rearing on the higher ground {Hexham and Northern}mart,owned by the Iveson family handles all the livestock sold by auction.In a year they sell about 300 dairy cows,160 000 cattle,including cows,calves and beef cattle,both for fattening and killing,and 75 000 sheep,including fat sheep to the butchers,and breeding ewes and lambs. Several{haulage contractors}have steady work transporting the animals. Quite near the mart is an{abattoir}run by the{Fatstock Meat}Corporation.They slaughter 100 fat cattle and 300 fat sheep each week.
